DataElement.preferredName: Kidney Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary kidney carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma or the renal pelvis.  The majority are renal cell carcinomas.  Kidney carcinomas usually affect middle aged and elderly adults.  Hematuria, abdominal pain, and a palpable mass are common symptoms._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma (renal cell carcinoma) or the renal pelvis (renal pelvis carcinoma).  The vast majority of renal cell carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.  The vast majority of renal pelvis carcinomas are transit

Concepts.longName: Kidney Carcinoma
Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma or the renal pelvis.  The majority are renal cell carcinomas.  Kidney carcinomas usually affect middle aged and elderly adults.  Hematuria, abdominal pain, and a palpable mass are common symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Clinical
Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 7th Ed., 2009
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for BBRB per request by G.Deen. mc 4/20/16

ValueDomain.preferredName: Kidney Cancer TNM Finding v7 American Joint Committee on Cancer T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of kidney cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  Renal pelvis and ureter cancers are not included in this classification. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: No evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor 7 cm or less in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor 7 cm or less in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor 4 cm or less in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor 4 cm or less in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 4 cm but not more than 7 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 4 cm but not more than 7 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 7 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 7 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 7 cm but less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 7 cm but less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 10 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 10 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor extending into major veins or perinephric tissues but not into the ipsilateral adrenal gland and not beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor extending into major veins or perinephric tissues but not into the ipsilateral adrenal gland and not beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the renal vein or its segmental (muscle containing) branches or tumor invading perirenal and/or renal sinus fat but not beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the renal vein or its segmental (muscle containing) branches or tumor invading perirenal and/or renal sinus fat but not beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the vena cava below the diaphragm. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the vena cava below the diaphragm. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor invading beyond Gerota's fascia (including contiguous extension into the ipsilateral adrenal gland). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor invading beyond Gerota's fascia (including contiguous extension into the ipsilateral adrenal gland). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer pT3c TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer pT3c TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the vena cava above the diaphragm, or invading the wall of the vena cava. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3c TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the vena cava above the diaphragm, or invading the wall of the vena cava. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pTX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.longName: American Joint Committee on Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
